title: UK children go online: listening to young people’s experiences
abstract: Full-text of this report is available at http://www.lse.ac.uk/collections/children-go-online/UKChildrenGoOnlineExec1.pdf

E-Society Programme, focuses on the nature of children’s internet use. The
report presents qualitative research findings, drawing on fourteen focus groups
with children. The next step will be to survey internet-related attitudes and
practices among 9-19 year olds across the UK.</dc:description><dc:description>Full-text of this report is available at http://www.lse.ac.uk/collections/children-go-online/UKChildrenGoOnlineExec1.pdf</dc:description><dc:publisher>The London School of Economics and Political Science</dc:publisher><dc:date>2010-03-24T14:59:22Z</dc:date><dc:type>Other</dc:type><dc:identifier>Livingstone, S. and Bober, M.
